item.title: John add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "...whenever there is inspiration...and enthusiasm...there is a creative empowerment that goes far beyond what a mere person is capable of." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: John add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Some changes look negative on the surface but you will soon realize that space is being created in your life for something new to emerge." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: John add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Once you have had a glimpse of awareness or Presence, you know it firsthand. It is no longer just a concept in your mind." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: John add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "Living up to an image that you have of yourself or that other people have of you is inauthentic living." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: John add a quote by Eckhart Tolle
item.description: "When another recognizes you, that recognition draws the dimension of Being more fully into this world through both of you. That is the love that redeems the world." -- Eckhart Tolle

item.title: John add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything." -- Mark Twain

item.title: John add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "A lie can travel half way around the world while the truth is putting on its shoes." -- Mark Twain

item.title: John add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Be careful about reading health books. You may die of a misprint." -- Mark Twain

item.title: John add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Classic' - a book which people praise and don't read." -- Mark Twain

item.title: John add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Donâ€™t go around saying the world owes you a living. The world owes you nothing. It was here first." -- Mark Twain

item.title: John add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "God created war so that Americans would learn geography." -- Mark Twain

item.title: John add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "If you pick up a starving dog and make him prosperous he will not bite you. This is the principal difference between a dog and man." -- Mark Twain

item.title: John add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "Travel is fatal to prejudice, bigotry, and narrow-mindedness, and many of our people need it sorely on these accounts. Broad, wholesome, charitable views of men and things cannot be acquired by vegetating in one little corner of the earth all one's lifetime." -- Mark Twain

item.title: John add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "I didn't have time to write a short letter, so I wrote a long one instead." -- Mark Twain

item.title: John add a quote by Maurice Switzer
item.description: "It is better to remain silent at the risk of being thought a fool, than to talk and remove all doubt of it." -- Maurice Switzer

item.title: John add a quote by Jennifer Egan
item.description: "The sky was electric blue above the trees but the yard felt dark. Stephanie went to the edge of the lawn and sat her forehead on her knees. The grass and soil were still warm from the day. She wanted to cry but she couldn't. The feeling was too deep." -- Jennifer Egan
